business.headline: Raymond shares jump 5%. Why stock hit upper circuit today?At the Bombay Stock Exchange, Raymond shares were locked at Rs 578.70 in early trade, up 4.99%. The buying comes a day after the stock appeared to lose more than 60% of its value, a fall that was not driven by weak fundamentals or selling pressure but by a mechanical price adjustment.

Rs 87,000 profit on listing? This IPO's GMP suggests bonanza for investorsVirtual Galaxy Infotech IPO: The IPO received a strong response from all categories of investors as it was subscribed 231.45 times overall.

Sensex falls over 500 points. Why is stock market falling today?At around 9:47 am, the Sensex was down 516.75 points at 80,839.01 while the Nifty hovered at 24,528.25, down 142.25 points. The selloff, however, remained largely confined to heavyweight largecaps. The broader market showed surprising strength, with midcap and smallcap indices trading firmly in the green.

BluSmart collapse: Banks, lessors rush to offload 2,000 EVs, says reportWith BluSmart unable to raise funds and its founders facing regulatory heat, several financiers have begun repossessing the EVs they leased or financed and are now either seeking buyers or looking to lease them to new operators.

Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares fell in early tradeAt around 9:19 am, the stock was trading 1% lower at Rs 773.95, following a report that said the bank's internal audit team is currently examining accounting entries related to 'other assets' and 'other liabilities', flagged in a whistleblower letter sent to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and the bank's board.
Sensex down 200 points, Nifty below 24,600; IndusInd Bank tumbles 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 281.04 points to 81,049.52, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48.10 points to 24,618.80 as of 9:25 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market see a rally today?Markets showed signs of profit booking and selling pressure in the broader segment on Wednesday. Despite that, analysts say the overall trend is still positive.

Stocks to watch on May 15: Infosys, SBI, Yes Bank, IREDA, Eicher MotorsSeveral companies will report their March quarter results on May 15, including LIC Housing Finance, Phillips India, Godrej Industries, INOX India, ITC Hotels, JSW Energy, Patanjali Foods, among others.
Pakistan receives 2nd IMF payout that India had objected toThis payment is part of the second instalment of a $7 billion IMF loan deal that began in September 2024 and will run for 37 months.
Markets end higher amid midcap rally; Sensex up 182 pointsThe BSE Sensex was up 182.34 points to 81,330.56 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 88.55 points higher at 24,666.90.

Cabinet approves new HCL-Foxconn semiconductor plant near Jewar AirportThis marks another significant step in India's ambitions to become a global semiconductor hub, with the proposed fab expected to bolster domestic chip-making capabilities and reduce dependence on imports.
India's wholesale inflation drops to 13-month low in AprilIndia's wholesale inflation dropped to 0.85% in April, a 13-month low, as prices of food, fuel, and key items cooled.

entertainment.headline: 'Fauji's daughter' Preity Zinta on Bollywood stars not condemning Pahalgam attackActor Preity Zinta, a 'fauji's daughter', was asked to comment on why her colleagues from the film industry have not condemned the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

Final Destination Bloodlines review: A seductive dance of deathReleased-Wed May 14, 2025'Bloodlines', the latest 'Final Destination' film, sets a chilling modern-day tale of death and curses. With innovative death scenes and a gripping family curse, it offers scares and surprises despite some flaws. Read our review.

Captain America Brave New World on OTT: When and where to watchMarvel Studios' 'Captain America: Brave New World', is all set to arrive on OTT this month. The film's rights have been sold to JioHotstar. The movie starred Anthony Mackie.

Vamika's cute reaction steals spotlight in Anushka-Virat's family clip with AkaayA never-seen-before video of the Kohli-Sharma family has surfaced online. The adorable clip is going viral for all the right reasons, featuring Anushka-Virat and their children, Vamika and Akaay.

Konkona Sensharma at rumoured boyfriend Amol Parashar's Gram Chikitsalay screeningRumoured lovebirds Amol Parashar and Konkona Sensharma were seen together at the screening of the former's latest show 'Gram Chikitsalay' on Wednesday. Several pictures and videos were circulated online.

Blake Lively 'threatened' Taylor Swift with private texts, claims Justin BaldoniIn a surprising turn of events, Blake Lively has sent private messages to Taylor Swift threatening her if she does not back her claims against Justin Baldoni. The revelations come from a recent court filing that has stirred Hollywood gossip.

Superman trailer: James Gunn ready to make Man of Steel the focal point againJames Gunn's new Superman film presents a complex hero grappling with public scrutiny and moral dilemmas in a changing world. The trailer reveals a Man of Steel who acts alone to stop war, facing criticism even from close allies like Lois Lane.

Jennifer Lopez suffers injury during rehearsals, ends up with black eye and a cutJennifer Lopez suffered a black eye and a cut on her nose during rehearsals for the American Music Awards 2025. She shared photos and thanked her doctor as she recovered ahead of hosting the event in Las Vegas.

Kamal Haasan's Thug Life trailer, audio launch dates out, AR Rahman to performThe audio launch of Kamal Haasan's 'Thug Life', which was scheduled to take place on May 16, has now been postponed. The makers announced the new date with new information on AR Rahman's performance.

Tom Cruise moved as Mission Impossible 8 gets 5-minute standing ovation at CannesIt was Tom Cruise on Day 2 of the ongoing Cannes Film Festival 2025. His upcoming film 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning' received a five-minute standing ovation, prompting Cruise to become emotional.

Actor Soori on evolution as lead actor: Will do socially responsible films from nowActor Soori shares his journey from small film jobs to becoming a lead actor and writer in Tamil cinema. His new film 'Maaman' promises a heartwarming family story releasing soon.

Ajay Devgn on Indo-Pak conflict: Nobody wants war, but no choice leftBollywood actor Ajay Devgn broke his silence on the India-Pakistan conflict at an event on Wednesday. He praised the Indian Armed Forces and the government for Operation Sindoor.

Bridgerton renewed for Seasons 5 and 6, Season 4 set for 2026 releaseNetflix has renewed Bridgerton for Seasons 5 and 6 ahead of its 2026 Season 4 premiere, which will focus on Benedict Bridgerton. The hit series continues under Shondaland's acclaimed production.

Rihanna returns with new single 'Friend of Mine' for upcoming Smurfs movieRihanna returns with new single "Friend of Mine" for the upcoming Smurfs movie, where she also stars. The film premieres July 18. She also announced her third pregnancy at the Met Gala.

HBO Max relaunch: Why Warner Bros. Discovery is bringing back its prestige brandWarner Bros. Discovery is rebranding its streaming platform from Max back to HBO Max this summer, signaling a renewed focus on high-quality, prestige content and leveraging HBO's globally recognized brand strength.

Steve Pepoon, Simpsons and Wild Thornberrys Writer, dies at 68Emmy-winning writer Steve Pepoon, known for his work on The Simpsons, died at 68. He also co-created The Wild Thornberrys. A Simpsons episode was pulled in the UK post-Trump incident.

SS Rajamouli gives funny reaction to 'RRR 2' query. WatchUpasana Kamineni playfully asked director SS Rajamouli about the much-awaited 'RRR 2' during a special London screening, sparking excitement among fans. While Rajamouli gave a humorous reaction, the sequel remains unconfirmed.

Ram Charan, Jr NTR hold hands at RRR screening at Royal Albert Hall, London. Watch'RRR' actor Ram Charan recently shared a reel on Instagram offering fans a peek into what went on backstage during the actor's recent visit to London for the 'RRR' live orchestra screening at the Royal Albert Hall on May 11, with director SS Rajamouli and co-star Jr NTR.

Ram Lakhan duo Jackie Shroff and Anil Kapoor to reunite for SRK's King: ReportBollywood stars Jackie Shroff and Anil Kapoor will be reuniting with Shah Rukh Khan for the action-packed thriller 'King', which begins filming on May 20.

general news.headline: Is this appropriate? Top court slams minister over remarks on Col Sofiya QureshiIs this appropriate? Top court raps Madhya Pradesh minister over remarks on Colonel Sofiya Qureshi

How can you...: President's 14 questions to Supreme Court on deadline rulingThe newly sworn-in Chief Justice of India (CJI), BR Gavai, faces his first challenge in addressing the President's question on whether the Supreme Court can set a timeline for governors and the President, as observed by a two-judge bench in a landmark judgment in the Tamil Nadu Governor case.

Verbally abused, blindfolded: How BSF jawan was treated in Pakistani custodyBSF jawan PK Shaw was handed over to Indian authorities by Pakistan after he was arrested on April 23 along the International Border in Punjab.

3 Jaish terrorists killed by security forces in Pulwama, fierce gunfight onThree terrorists were killed in a gunfight with security forces early on Thursday in the Nadir village of Tral area in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district. This is the second encounter in the union territory within 48 hours.

Indian Test team after Rohit, Virat: A peek into the futureIndia have plenty to think about going into the Test series against England after Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retired from Test cricket. India are also looking to make amends after failing to qualify for the WTC 2023-25 final.

News Menu, May 15: India to roast Pak at UN; BJP tiranga yatra; Turkey boycottedIndia Today serves a fiery news platter—India stands firm on Indus waters, Kashmir locals reject Pakistan, and Rajnath Singh boosts troop morale amid border tensions. From Pak flag crackdowns to Turkey boycotts and a grim Damoh tragedy, today's headlines blend defiance, unity, and sorrow.

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in Srinagar, 5 days after India-Pak ceasefireIn his first visit to the Union Territory since India launched Operation Sindoor on May 7, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will visit the Chinar Corps headquarters in Srinagar.

Modi's watershed war doctrine lurks well below Pakistan's N-thresholdIndia has become the first nuclear-weapon state to attack another nuclear power using the air force. Before this, a nuclear weapons state has never shot a ballistic missile at another N-weapon state, for fear this could be misconstrued as a nuclear weapons launch.

Delhi chokes as AQI crosses 200 after dust storm: What caused the sudden spike?Dust pollution in Delhi surged overnight, pushing AQI above 200 into the 'poor' category, with visibility dropping sharply due to strong, dust-laden winds.

In his 1st verdict, Chief Justice flags politician-builder nexus in Pune land scamNewly sworn-in Chief Justice of India, BR Gavai, delivered his first verdict since taking over the reins, ruling that the forest land handed over by the Maharashtra government was illegal.

Killing poor Gaza kids: Ben & Jerry's founder arrested for US Senate protestIn a viral video, Ben Cohen is seen standing up in the seating area behind US Health Secretary Robert Kennedy Jr and shouting, 'Congress pays for bombs to kill children in Gaza'.

Rajnath Singh visits Chinar Corps Headquarter, will interact with forcesIndia-Pakistan Ceasefire Live: Three terrorists are killed in a gunfight ongoing in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district between security forces and Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorists. A team from India arrived in New York to meet the UN 1267 sanctions committee over the Pahalgam terror attack where 26 people - mostly tourists – were killed. Following the attack, Indian armed forces launched Operation Sindoor on May 7 targeting terrorist hideouts in Pakistan. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh told an all-party meeting on May 8 that at least 100 hardcore terrorists and their associates were killed in Indian strikes on terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir (PoK) under the ongoing Operation Sindoor. The two neighbouring countries reached an understanding for ceasefire on May 10 following intense cross-border strikes for four days. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

Tom Cruise moved as Mission Impossible 8 gets 5-minute standing ovation at CannesIt was Tom Cruise on Day 2 of the ongoing Cannes Film Festival 2025. His upcoming film 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning' received a five-minute standing ovation, prompting Cruise to become emotional.

India had 'clear edge' in military strikes on Pakistan: New York Times reportIndia had a clear edge over Pakistan in a recent military standoff, with satellite imagery showing precision strikes on key Pakistani military targets, according to a detailed New York Times report.

Tail between its legs: Ex-Pentagon insider rips into Pak after India strikesFormer Pentagon official Michael Rubin said India decisively defeated Pakistan both militarily and diplomatically after Operation Sindoor, exposing Pakistan's terror links and forcing global focus on Islamabad's support for militants.

Crossed Lakshman Rekha: Shashi Tharoor faces Congress heat over Op Sindoor remarksCongress MP Shashi Tharoor faced heat for his recent remarks on the India-Pakistan conflict, with a party leader saying he crossed the 'Lakshman Rekha' for such statements, according to party sources.

Final Destination Bloodlines review: A seductive dance of deathReleased-Wed May 14, 2025'Bloodlines', the latest 'Final Destination' film, sets a chilling modern-day tale of death and curses. With innovative death scenes and a gripping family curse, it offers scares and surprises despite some flaws. Read our review.

Pak vows to rebuild mosque in LeT den Muridke destroyed by India in Op SindoorPakistan's federal minister Rana Tanveer Hussain visited Muridke on Wednesday said that the Pak government has promised to rebuild the town at government expense after it was destroyed by India in Operation Sindoor in response to Pahalgam terror attack.

5, including 2 children, die as bus catches fire in UP, driver jumps out, fleesA moving sleeper bus caught fire in Lucknow, killing five passengers as the driver escaped. The bus, travelling from Delhi to Bihar, was reduced to ashes within minutes.

Launch of Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to Space Station postponedShukla, who was originally scheduled to launch on May 29 as part of Axiom Space's Ax-4 mission, will now lift off from Nasa's Kennedy Space Center in Florida in early June due to a minor technical issue detected during pre-launch preparations.

Blake Lively 'threatened' Taylor Swift with private texts, claims Justin BaldoniIn a surprising turn of events, Blake Lively has sent private messages to Taylor Swift threatening her if she does not back her claims against Justin Baldoni. The revelations come from a recent court filing that has stirred Hollywood gossip.

Tigress gives birth to 3 cubs in Ranthambore, forest department shares picturesLocal villagers were the first to observe the tigress with her cubs and informed the forest department, which has since intensified monitoring efforts.

Two nations, one future: Aroon Purie at India Today's Indo-UAE ConclaveIndia Today Group's Chairman and Editor-in-Chief Aroon Purie highlighted how India-UAE ties go beyond economics. While speaking at India Today's Indo-UAE conclave, he said the partnership between the two countries is time-tested, multi-dimensional, and future-ready.

Gravity reveals what's hiding beneath the Moon's surfaceThe moon's nearside is covered by vast plains, called mare, formed from molten rock that cooled and solidified billions of years ago. Its farside has much more rugged terrain, with few plains.

'Fauji's daughter' Preity Zinta on Bollywood stars not condemning Pahalgam attackActor Preity Zinta, a 'fauji's daughter', was asked to comment on why her colleagues from the film industry have not condemned the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

With innovative death scenes and a gripping family curse, it offers scares and surprises despite some flaws. Read our review.

Captain America Brave New World on OTT: When and where to watchMarvel Studios' 'Captain America: Brave New World', is all set to arrive on OTT this month. The film's rights have been sold to JioHotstar. The movie starred Anthony Mackie.

Vamika's cute reaction steals spotlight in Anushka-Virat's family clip with AkaayA never-seen-before video of the Kohli-Sharma family has surfaced online. The adorable clip is going viral for all the right reasons, featuring Anushka-Virat and their children, Vamika and Akaay.

sports.headline: RCB may have to play Liam Livingstone with doubt over major stars: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra feels that RCB may need to turn to the underperforming Liam Livingstone for the remainder of the IPL 2025 season if their big names may not be available once the season restarts.

Didn't let him dominate: Alcaraz says aggression helped him vs DraperItalian Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz advanced to the semi-final of the men's singles in Rome after beating Jack Draper 6-3, 6-4 in an hour and 37 minutes.

Carlo Ancelotti was brought in to get results: Brazil legends hail appointmentBrazil legends Dunga, Felipe Melo and Mauro Silva have hailed the appointment of Carlo Ancelotti as the new coach of the national team. The legends are hoping Ancelotti can bring about a change in fortunes for Brazil.

Former Mumbai Indians pacer earns England recall for West Indies T20IsFast-bowling all-rounder Issy Wong has made her comeback into the England Women's T20I team for their three-match series against the West Indies. Wong recently impressed for England A on their tour of England.

South Africa board makes IPL U-turn, to resume WTC final preparations after May 3Cricket South Africa has done a U-turn, saying that the players selected in the squad for the World Test Championship final against Australia could come back on June 3. Initially, CSA said that they want the players back by May 26.

Loved watching Virat Kohli every day of his 123 Tests: AthertonFormer England captain Michael Atherton praised Virat Kohli for his dedication and commitment to Test cricket, adding that he thoroughly enjoyed watching him play throughout his career.

Mustafizur leaves for UAE amid uncertainty over IPL 2025 participationBangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman was signed by the Delhi Capitals for IPL 2025, but he recently left for the UAE to take part in the two-match T20I series in Sharjah.

Indian Test team after Rohit, Virat: A peek into the futureIndia have plenty to think about going into the Test series against England after Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retired from Test cricket. India are also looking to make amends after failing to qualify for the WTC 2023-25 final.

Watch: Sabalenka responds strongly to heckler in clash vs Qinwen ZhengItalian Open 2025: World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka was not happy with a fan as she lost to Qinwen Zheng in straight sets in the quarterfinal on Wednesday, May 14.

Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim insists he has no plans to quitManchester United manager Ruben Amorim said he has no plans to leave the club, claiming his passionate comments following Sunday's 2-0 loss to West Ham United sprang from a sense of responsibility for the team's bad performance.

IPL 2025: Romario Shepherd, Liam Livingstone rejoin RCB squad in BengaluruRCB's overseas recruits Romario Shepherd and Liam Livingstone are back in India to rejoin the Royal Challengers Bengaluru squad ahead of the last leg of IPL 2025.

Mustafizur leaves for UAE amid uncertainty over IPL 2025 participationBangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman was signed by the Delhi Capitals for IPL 2025, but he recently left for the UAE to take part in the two-match T20I series in Sharjah.

Indian Test team after Rohit, Virat: A peek into the futureIndia have plenty to think about going into the Test series against England after Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retired from Test cricket. India are also looking to make amends after failing to qualify for the WTC 2023-25 final.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
